review: Best device for streaming video.  I do a lot of video streaming from iTunes, Netflix, ABC, and Airplay (Audio and video from iPhone/iPads)If you don't have Apple products (iPhone/iPad/Macs), the AppleTV might not be the best for your own media content streaming (It does not offer a way to attach to shared network folders).If you do have Apple products and use iTunes for your music library, the Apple TV is your best choice IMO. Apple TV offers easy setup using Apples Home sharing, the remote app for iPhone/ipod/iPad is great and streaming Local LAN, Netflix and other AppleTV content is better then any competing products I have tried.  I have tried quite a few of them...You can certainly just plug it into a Tv and watch content, but its nice to also plug into your Audio Receiver and Airplay your own Music, Pandora, iTunes Radio etc. to your home stereo.  I have an old iPhone I use as a remote control and Airplay music streaming during Parties at the house.Again, if you have Macs or iPhones/iPads, this is your best if not the only solution you should be considering.
author: Kevin

review: I have had this for about a week and there are no surprises.  It works as advertised but there are the usual Apple disappointments like No Pandora (it is a competitor) and a rather limited list of services, many of which require a paid subscription.I can stream music from my iTunes library directly to my TV and that is nice but sound like a TV.I am going to try to add a bluetooth keyboard as the remote control search keyboard in Youtube is insane.As always, the Apple product comes with almost no printed instructions and Apple's on-line help stinks.  An "older" user may be challenged by this product unless they are already an "Apple-head."I would suggest trying the Roku3 or Amazon's new offering.  I think they both offer more functionality for the money.
